[Timeline](/wiki/Timeline_of_Singaporean_history) - Riots - [Military](/wiki/Military_history_of_Singapore) Singapore portal - v - t - e Riots in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) have been documented since its [founding as a British colony in 1819](/wiki/1819_Singapore_Treaty) and when it became part of the [Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements) in 1826. In the present day, under the [Penal Code](/wiki/Penal_Code_(Singapore)), rioting refers to the unlawful gathering of five or more people where force or violence is used by any member of the assembly; an affray is committed if two or more people fight in a public place. The **list of riots in Singapore** below describes the most serious and prominent ones. ## Straits Settlements (United Kingdom) [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_in_the_Straits_Settlements) in the [Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements) (1826–(/wiki/Fall_of_Singapore)/1946) - 15 – 20 February 1851 – Anti-Catholic riots (500 dead) - 5 – 17 May 1854 – Hokkien-Teochew riots (200 to 480 dead, 222 injured) - 15 December 1876 – Chinese Post Office Riots - 12 March 1927 – Kreta Ayer Incident [zh] ## Colony of Singapore (United Kingdom) [Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore) (1946–1963) - 11 December 1950 – [Maria Hertogh riots](/wiki/Maria_Hertogh_riots) (18 dead, 173 injured) - 13 May 1954 – [1954 National Service riots](/wiki/1954_National_Service_riots) (26 injured) - 12 May 1955 – [Hock Lee bus riots](/wiki/Hock_Lee_bus_riots) (4 dead, 31 injured) - 26 October 1956 – [Chinese middle schools riots](/wiki/Chinese_middle_schools_riots) (13 dead, more than 100 injured) - 22 April 1963 – City Hall riot ## State of Singapore (Malaysia) [State of Singapore](/wiki/State_of_Singapore_(Malaysia)) (1963–1965) - 12 July 1963 – [Pulau Senang prison riot](/wiki/Pulau_Senang_prison_riot) (4 dead, 5 injured) - 21 July and 2 September 1964 – [1964 race riots](/wiki/1964_race_riots_in_Singapore) (36 dead, 560 injured) ## Republic of Singapore [Republic of Singapore](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore) (1965–present) - 31 May to 6 June 1969 – [1969 race riots](/wiki/1969_race_riots_of_Singapore) (4 dead, 80 injured) - 8 December 2013 – [2013 Little India riot](/wiki/2013_Little_India_riot) (62 injured)
title: List of riots in Singapore
